snippet: Legislation that bans promoting homosexuality in Russia has some gay rights advocates calling for protests or a boycott of the 2014 Olympics in Sochi.
abstract: Vitaly L Mutko, Russia’s minister of sports, says that foreign athletes traveling to Russia for the 2014 Olympics in Sochi will be expected to obey Russian law banning 'homosexual propaganda' or face criminal prosecution; statement seems sure to stoke criticism of the law, which has already become a point of contention for the Games, with some calls for a boycott.
lead_paragraph: Legislation that bans promoting homosexuality in Russia has some gay rights advocates calling for protests or a boycott of the 2014 Olympics in Sochi.

headline.main: Athletes in Sochi to Be Barred From Advocating Gay Causes
